title: Breakthrough Gravitational Wave Findings Suggest Supermassive Black Holes Are Constantly Warping Spacetime
description:
Astronomers and astrophysicists at five different pulsar timing array collaborations today announced data that strongly suggests the presence of a gravitational wave background: a constant murmur of low-frequency ripples in spacetime that emanates from some of the universe’s most exotic objects.

Read more...

title: Elon Musk's Parents: Please Don't Let Our Grown Child Fight The Facebook Guy
description:
Few things in life have thrilled me more than the prospect of seeing Elon Musk and Mark Zuckerberg tape their knuckles up and step into a ring to settle their differences like a couple of misshapen Macaque monkeys tussling over a piece of fermented fruit. If you haven’t heard about this, I beg you to do a quick Google…

title: 10 Horror Movies That Make Hospitals Even More Freaky
description:
There are lots of horror movies themed around psychiatric hospitals—be they fully functional facilities, like A Nightmare on Elm Street Part 3: Dream Warriors, or abandoned, like Session 9. Regular medical hospitals don’t pop up nearly as often—but as these 10 films show, leaning into what’s already an unsettling…

title: We're Already Living in Barbie's Barbiecore Pink World
description:
After seeing all of the pink Barbie movie collections available, I’m definitely not thinking about death anymore.

title: Warner Bros. Discovery May Bring Live CNN to Its Max Streaming Platform
description:
Warner Bros. Discovery is reportedly bringing live content from CNN to its rebranded streaming service, Max, in the coming year. It appears to be a move toward more news-related content, sources close to the matter told Bloomberg.

Read more...

title: DC Comics Announces Big Presence at Comic-Con, But No Live-Action Movies Yet
description:
What would San Diego Comic-Con be without big showings from the biggest companies in the world of comics? While we recently learned that Marvel Studios, the film and TV arm of Marvel, will only have a presence on the convention floor—we now know that DC Comics will have a huge overall presence across the convention.

Read more...

title: 21 Mandalorian Season 3 Facts Revealed in New Behind-the-Scenes Documentary
description:
It’s been two months since season three of The Mandalorian came to an end, and now it’s time to find out how they got there. This week, Disney+ released the latest episode of Disney Gallery: Star Wars The Mandalorian, a behind-the-scenes documentary about the making of the popular show.

Read more...

title: Women Jailed for Refusing TB Treatment Sent Home, Will Have to Take Meds or Else
description:
The long-running saga over a Washington woman’s refusal to get treated for tuberculosis might finally be drawing to a close. The woman was released from a local jail late last week, under the condition that she stay isolated at home and complete her course of antibiotics. Should she fail to do so, she could be…

Read more...

title: Anonymous Disney Imagineer Purportedly Confirms Donald Trump Animatronic Is Hillary Clinton
description:
Stranger things have happened, but this one conspiracy theory might actually be true. Alex Goldman, the former host of the once-heralded, now-defunct podcast Reply All, may have just cracked the code on whether Disney replaced the skin of a Hillary Clinton robot with that of Donald Trump.

Read more...

title: Hasbro's New Indiana Jones Toys Relive The Last Crusade
description:
To celebrate the release of Indiana Jones and the Dial of Destiny this week, Hasbro decided to mostly ignore that movie and show us a whole host of toys from the climactic entry in the original Indy trilogy, The Last Crusade. Did they choose wisely? Maybe, but it doesn’t mean we didn’t get at least some hints of what…

title: Spielberg and Scorsese May Have Just Saved TCM From Zaslav's Destructive Warpath
description:
Cinephile’s cherished Turner Classic Movies was slated to be Warner Bros. Discovery’s latest amputation of beloved content. Out of the blue, famed directors Steven Spielberg, Martin Scorsese, and Paul Thomas Anderson stepped up to bat for the classic cinema channel. Now it seems the three have managed to hold Warner…

title: Why 2,000 Ancient PCs Mysteriously Appeared on eBay
description:
Natural Access to Bi-directional Utilities. Doesn’t sound very exciting, does it? But the acronym NABU is becoming one of most interesting, burgeoning spaces for retro computer devs. Thanks to the cheap sale of these once-defunct PCs, more and more people are helping to revitalize a long-defunct cable internet service…

title: Captain Janeway Didn't Deserve This
description:
Paramount’s decision to unceremoniously both renege on its season two greenlight for Star Trek: Prodigy and completely remove the show from its streaming platform has created a PR nightmare of its own making with many, many layers to it. But amid all the concerns, the thing I keep thinking about is just how rude it is…

title: Evan Peters Joins Jared Leto in Disney's Tron 3
description:
The long-in-development third installment of the Tron franchise is set to shoot this August—if the SAG strike doesn’t happen—and it’s just added a new star to its cast.

title: Here Are the First Photos of the Recovered Titanic Tourist Submersible
description:
Pelagic Research Services is recovering debris from the Titan submersible which fatally imploded while journeying to view the Titanic wreckage last week, killing all five crew members on board. Search and rescue teams searched a 900 sq-foot area over four days in a mission that ended abruptly when an ROV discovered…

title: United CEO Points Finger at FAA Over Latest Flight Cancellations at NYC Area Airports
description:
As hundreds of flights to and from the East Coast were canceled this week due to severe weather, the CEO of United has an axe to grind. In a leaked email, Scott Kirby, the airline’s head honcho, blamed the Federal Aviation Administration for the cancellations.

Read more...

title: Computer, Enhance: Scientists Reconstruct 3D Images From Eye Reflections
description:
There’s a saying that the eyes are the window to a person’s soul, but according to a team of researchers from the University of Maryland, the eyes might instead be a mirror, providing enough data to reconstruct exactly what a person in a short video clip was looking at as an interactive 3D model.

Read more...

title: Roland Emmerich Hates Earth So Much He's Founding Space Nation
description:
Director Roland Emmerich hates Earth. This we know; it’s why so many of his movies feature the planet under attack by aliens, Godzillas, moons, and so forth. But it appears his frustration with not being able to properly destroy the planet is getting to him, because Emmerich is going to space... specifically Space…

Read more...

title: Vizio Is Finally Bringing Its Smart TV User Interface Into the Modern Era
description:
Smart TV company Vizio is more known for its budget screens than it is for a functional, modern UI. Now, the company said it’s finally ready for a facelift, one that’s been a long time coming. Starting on Wednesday, Vizio’s new interface does away with its old box-y look and rearranges icons to make finding apps and…

Read more...

title: Nick Fury Has No More Friends to Call in Secret Invasion
description:
Episode two of Secret Invasion, Marvel’s new Nick Fury (Samuel L. Jackson) series, continues the trend started in episode one by further cutting him off from the people he trusts. Fury’s biggest power isn’t flying around, super strength, or how good his gadgets are; his secret weapon has always been in how big his…

title: Decoding Dark Matter and Energy: What You Need to Know About the Euclid Mission Launching This Weekend
description:
Together, dark matter and dark energy comprise 95% of the known universe, yet scientists don’t know what they are. The Euclid telescope, set to launch to space from Florida on Saturday, may help decipher them.

Read more...

title: Texas Power Use Breaks Record as Heat Wave Continues to Roast the South
description:
Businesses and homes throughout Texas cranked up their air conditioning this week during the ongoing heat dome, pushing the grid into record-breaking energy usage.

Read more...

title: Bird Box Barcelona Brings Blind Terror to Spain
description:
Is a European post-apocalypse the big new fad? Case in point: The Walking Dead: Daryl Dixon will bring the character to meet the zombies of France. Now, Bird Box Barcelona wants to bring the series’ mysterious, suicide-inducing entities to Spain, and its first trailer is here.

Read more...

title: D'oh: NASA's Perseverance Rover Finds an Other Worldly Treat on Mars
description:
While roaming the Martian terrain, NASA’s Perseverance rover spotted an odd-shaped rock that may have traveled its way from space to land on the Red Planet.

Read more...

title: Costco Puts a Stop to Sharing Membership Cards
description:
Costco members should be wary of sharing their cards with friends or family as the company takes action against non-members. The company announced on Tuesday that it is cracking down on card-sharing, and members will soon be required to show proof of identification at the checkout counters before they can make a…

Read more...

title: Movies Are Being Killed by Franchise Ambitions
description:
It’s often impossible to watch something completely divorced from the context surrounding it. Despite what some may have you believe, once you know about the controversy attached to a film or show, you can’t un-know it, and that’s going to affect how you view the finished product in question.

Read more...

title: Elon Musk Enlists Help From UFC Champion Ahead of Potential Zuckerberg Brawl
description:
The battle of the billionaires is heating up, and Elon Musk is looking to claim a win. Ahead of a potential cage match with Meta’s own Mark Zuckerberg, Musk has accepted an offer from UFC champion and former mixed martial arts fighter George St-Pierre.

Read more...

title: DoorDash Workers Can Finally Get Paid Hourly, But Only During Deliveries
description:
With more laws on the books demanding additional pay for gig workers, DoorDash has finally come around to offering some hourly pay for its Dashers, though only when they’re hoofing it to their delivery spot. The food delivery app announced Wednesday that contract delivery drivers can now earn a base hourly pay and…

Read more...

title: TikTok Bankrolls Influencers' Lawsuit Against Montana Ban
description:
The lawsuit lodged against Montana’s historic TikTok ban by influencers in the state earlier last month may not have a grassroots effort. What seemed to be a creator-led legal rebuke was actually financed by TikTok itself.

Read more...

title: Upcoming Orbital Test Could Enable Tracking of Super Tiny Space Debris
description:
ODIN Space has passed a major milestone by powering up a super-sensitive experimental in-space sensor. Once fully developed, a dispersed network of these sensors could be capable of tracking hypervelocity objects no larger than a grain of sand.

Read more...

title: Mortal Kombat 2 Might Bring Another Classic Fighter With It
description:
It’s never too early to start learning about spooky Christmas horror movies. Margot Robbie discusses the chances of a Barbie sequel. Plus, behind the scenes footage from Venom 3, and what’s coming on this week’s Star Trek: Strange New Worlds. Spoilers, away!

title: Shokz First Wireless Earbuds Let You Hear the World Around You
description:
Although far more convenient to carry around than a set of over-ear headphones, wireless earbuds can often become uncomfortable when crammed into your ears for hours. With its new OpenFit wireless earbuds, Shokz is promising all day comfort via an open-ear design that ensures you can also hear everything going on…

title: The Vatican Releases Its Own AI Ethics Handbook
description:
The Vatican is getting in on the AI craze. The Holy See has released a handbook on the ethics of artificial intelligence as defined by the Pope.

title: Desperation for a Viral Moment Is Driving Concerts Off the Rails
description:
On June 18, Bebe Rexha was performing a hometown show at The Rooftop at Pier 17 in Manhattan. During the performance, an audience member threw an iPhone at the pop singer-songwriter, which hit her just over the right eye. The impact immediately ended the show, and Rexha required three stitches in the aftermath,…
